https://t.co/jAZCGbVv9n (2/2) https://t.co/W9Zhe51m61

4/

The article reports a single-center (Karolinska University Hospital in Stockholm, Sweden), consecutive hospitalized adults’ neuroimaging experience, with 47/43 (exams/pts) MRI and 222/174 CT for evaluation. 75% male, 25% mortality, 62% on ventilator (19 days mean duration) https://t.co/Afuo9fhPsh

5/

Intra-axial susceptibilities were most common (74%), often with a non-spherical shape and predilection for white matter tract, suggestive of microvascular pathology (endotheliopathy, microthrombosis, and microinfarction) https://t.co/iklOvngmVr

6/

Leukoencephalopathy was the second most common (44%), and may have a dynamic nature. Although nonspecific, these signals may hint at neuro-inflammatory complications of COVID-19 https://t.co/ChWxM8yJX1

7/

Macrovascular pathology was also seen. 15 (8.6%) patients had acute ischemic infarcts, 11 (6.3%) with non-traumatic hemorrhage, 1 hemorrhagic infarct, and 6 patients with thin circumferential vessel wall enhancement https://t.co/YKR5HXbmtQ

8/

Cranial nerve involvement included ↑ T2 of the olfactory bulb/tract (19%), optic nerve prominent subarachnoid space (56%), bilateral facial nerve enhancement (n=1) and unilateral vestibular nerve enhancement (n=1). Cauda equina nerve roots enhancement was seen in 2 cases https://t.co/cvKmyUZnxj

9/

In summary, neuroimaging of COVID-19 patients show vascular and inflammatory changes. Microvascular and white matter pathology are common. Radiologists should also be vigilant for cranial nerve and spinal nerve root involvement.

10/

This tweetorial is based on this Radiology open-access article: https://t.co/Wdc5lHZMJ4. Check out their paper and supplemental figures.

Thanks @pollockjeff @RadITrainEditor @RadiologyEditor for support and guidance

@_ktellen This is legit one of the funniest tweets I’ve seen.
@DavidWaldstein W.H.O.'s on first.
The relentless violence finally silenced the opposition, and it seemed nobody would ever learn who these scientists were, or why they fought this thing so adamantly and passionately.
And PCR, though its inventor died last year, and isn’t here to address it, plays a central role in Corona terrorism.
